abort.fw_download_failed: {firmware_name} firmware for your {model} failed to download. Make sure Home Assistant has internet access and try again.
abort.fw_install_failed: {firmware_name} firmware failed to install, check Home Assistant logs for more information.
abort.not_hassio_thread: The OpenThread Border Router add-on can only be installed with Home Assistant OS. If you would like to use the {model} as a Thread border router, please manually set up OpenThread Border Router to communicate with it.
abort.otbr_addon_already_running: The OpenThread Border Router add-on is already running, it cannot be installed again.
abort.otbr_still_using_stick: This {model} is in use by the OpenThread Border Router add-on. If you use the Thread network, make sure you have alternative border routers. Uninstall the add-on and try again.
abort.unsupported_firmware: The radio firmware on your {model} could not be determined. Make sure that no other integration or add-on is currently trying to communicate with the device. If you are running Home Assistant OS in a virtual machine or in Docker, please make sure that permissions are set correctly for the device.
abort.zha_still_using_stick: This {model} is in use by the Zigbee Home Automation integration. Please migrate your Zigbee network to another adapter or delete the integration and try again.

progress.install_firmware:
Installing {firmware_name} firmware.

Do not make any changes to your hardware or software until this finishes.

confirm_otbr.description: Your {model} is now an OpenThread Border Router and will show up in the Thread integration.
confirm_otbr.title: OpenThread Border Router setup complete

confirm_zigbee.description: Your {model} is now a Zigbee coordinator and will be shown as discovered by the Zigbee Home Automation integration.
confirm_zigbee.title: Zigbee setup complete

otbr_failed.description: The OpenThread Border Router add-on installation was unsuccessful. Ensure no other software is trying to communicate with the {model}, you have access to the Internet and can install other add-ons, and try again. Check the Supervisor logs if the problem persists.
otbr_failed.title: Failed to set up OpenThread Border Router

pick_firmware.description: You can use your {model} for a Zigbee or Thread network. Please check what type of devices you want to add to Home Assistant. You can always change this later.

menu_option_descriptions.pick_firmware_thread: Often used for Matter over Thread devices.
menu_option_descriptions.pick_firmware_thread_migrate: This will migrate your Thread Border Router to the new adapter.
menu_option_descriptions.pick_firmware_zigbee_migrate: This will move your Zigbee network to the new adapter.

menu_options.pick_firmware_thread_migrate: Migrate Thread to a new adapter
menu_options.pick_firmware_zigbee_migrate: Migrate Zigbee to a new adapter

pick_firmware.title: Pick your protocol

zigbee_installation_type.description: Choose the installation type for the Zigbee adapter.

menu_option_descriptions.zigbee_intent_custom: Manually install and configure Zigbee, for example with Zigbee2MQTT.

zigbee_installation_type.title: Set up Zigbee

menu_option_descriptions.zigbee_integration_other: For example if you want to use the adapter with Zigbee2MQTT.
menu_option_descriptions.zigbee_integration_zha: Lets Home Assistant control a Zigbee network.

abort.addon_already_running: Failed to start the {addon_name} add-on because it is already running.
abort.not_hassio: The hardware options can only be configured on Home Assistant OS installations.
abort.zha_migration_failed: The ZHA migration did not succeed.

progress.install_addon: Please wait while the {addon_name} add-on installation finishes. This can take several minutes.
progress.start_addon: Please wait while the {addon_name} add-on start completes. This may take some seconds.

addon_installed_other_device.title: Multiprotocol support is already enabled for another device

addon_not_installed.description:
When multi-protocol support is enabled, the {hardware_name}'s IEEE 802.15.4 radio can be used for both Zigbee and Thread (used by Matter) at the same time. If the radio is already used by the ZHA Zigbee integration, ZHA will be reconfigured to use the multi-protocol firmware.

Note: This is an experimental feature.
addon_not_installed.title: Enable multi-protocol support on the IEEE 802.15.4 radio

change_channel.description:
Start a channel change for your Zigbee and Thread networks.

Note: this is an advanced operation and can leave your Thread and Zigbee networks inoperable if the new channel is congested. Depending on existing network conditions, many of your devices may not migrate to the new channel and will require re-joining before they start working again. Use with caution.

Once you have selected **Submit**, the channel change starts quietly in the background and will finish after a few minutes.
change_channel.title: Reconfigure IEEE 802.15.4 radio multi-protocol support

install_addon.title: The Silicon Labs Multiprotocol add-on installation has started

notify_channel_change.description: A Zigbee and Thread channel change has been initiated and will finish in {delay_minutes} minutes.
notify_channel_change.title: Channel change initiated

notify_unknown_multipan_user.description: Home Assistant can automatically change the channels for OTBR and ZHA. If you have configured another integration to use the radio, for example Zigbee2MQTT, you will have to reconfigure the channel in that integration after completing this guide.
notify_unknown_multipan_user.title: Manual configuration may be needed

start_addon.title: The Silicon Labs Multiprotocol add-on is starting.

uninstall_addon.description:
Disabling multi-protocol support will revert your {hardware_name}'s radio back to Zigbee-only firmware and will disable Thread support provided by the {hardware_name}. Your Thread devices will continue working only if you have another Thread border router nearby.

It will take a few minutes to install the Zigbee firmware and restoring a backup.
uninstall_addon.title: Remove IEEE 802.15.4 radio multi-protocol support
